titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the World Student Christian Federation Records - Addendum
World Student Christian Federation Records - Addendum
titlestmt.author: Compiled by Robert Mills

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 2, 2019 at 22:01

did.unittitle: World Student Christian Federation Records, Addendum
did.abstract: This is addendum contains primarily printed WSCF records gathered by the Library up through 2015. It complements the WSCF archives of Record Group No. 46. The World Student Christian Federation was created in 1895 as an international student Christian movement which could encourage and coordinate the work of national student Christian movements.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: World Student Christian Federation Records - Addendum C (RG 46C), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The World's Student Christian Federation was created in 1895 to fulfill its founders' vision of an international student

Christian movement which could encourage and coordinate the work of existing national student Christian movements, as well as stimulate the formation of unified student movements in countries where they did not exist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These records are complemented by the Archives of the WSCF, WSCF North America Regional Office, and WSCF Board of Trustees held at YDSL, as well as the personal papers of Ruth Harris, Margaret Flory, and Newton Thurber.
